title: Wildfire breaks out in forest near Athens
Afghan women's rights an internal issue, says Taliban ahead of UN talks
content: Taliban authorities in a press briefing stated that demands over women's rights were "Afghanistan's issues" to solve, ahead of United Nations-led engagement talks where the exclusion of Afghan women has sparked outcry. Rights groups have condemned the exclusion of Afghan women from the main meetings and the lack of human rights issues on the agenda.
summary: Taliban authorities in a press briefing stated that demands over women's rights were "Afghanistan's issues" to solve, ahead of United Nations-led engagement talks where the exclusion of Afghan women has sparked outcry. Rights groups have condemned the exclusion of Afghan women from the main meetings and the lack of human rights issues on the agenda.

title: 5 bombs found in iconic Iraq mosque, planted years ago by IS: UN agency
content: A United Nations agency said it has discovered five bombs in a wall of Mosul's iconic Al-Nuri mosque, planted years ago by Islamic State group jihadists, during restoration work in the northern Iraqi city. Five "large-scale explosive devices, designed to trigger a massive destruction of the site," were found in the southern wall of the prayer hall on Tuesday by the UNESCO team working at the site, a representative for the agency told AFP late Friday.
summary: A United Nations agency said it has discovered five bombs in a wall of Mosul's iconic Al-Nuri mosque, planted years ago by Islamic State group jihadists, during restoration work in the northern Iraqi city. Five "large-scale explosive devices, designed to trigger a massive destruction of the site," were found in the southern wall of the prayer hall on Tuesday by the UNESCO team working at the site, a representative for the agency told AFP late Friday.

title: Iran presidential elections: Runoff between reformist Pezeshkian and hard-liner Jalili; what are the rules
Iran seesawing vote results put race between reformist Masoud Pezeshkian and hard-liner Saeed Jalili
A pink blob with beady eyes: Robot with 'living skin' and a pretty smile
content: University of Tokyo professor Shoji Takeuchi has developed a robot with "living skin," gaining attention for its human-like features. Engineered with 3D-printed lab-grown meat, biological muscle tissue, and advanced adhesion technology, the robot mimics human skin-ligament structures. Future goals include adding features like sweat glands and achieving more lifelike movement, promising applications in medicine and robotics.
summary: University of Tokyo professor Shoji Takeuchi has developed a robot with "living skin," gaining attention for its human-like features. Engineered with 3D-printed lab-grown meat, biological muscle tissue, and advanced adhesion technology, the robot mimics human skin-ligament structures. Future goals include adding features like sweat glands and achieving more lifelike movement, promising applications in medicine and robotics.

title: US military destroys seven drones, vehicle in Yemen's Houthi-control region
content: Over the past 24 hours, US forces have destroyed seven drones and a control station vehicle in areas of Yemen controlled by the Huthis. The US Central Command stated that the strikes were carried out in response to an imminent threat to US coalition forces and merchant vessels in the region. The Huthis are an Iran-backed group that has been targeting vessels in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden since November 2023. They claim their attacks are in solidarity with Palestinians during the Israel-Hamas war in the Gaza Strip.
summary: Over the past 24 hours, US forces have destroyed seven drones and a control station vehicle in areas of Yemen controlled by the Huthis. The US Central Command stated that the strikes were carried out in response to an imminent threat to US coalition forces and merchant vessels in the region. The Huthis are an Iran-backed group that has been targeting vessels in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden since November 2023. They claim their attacks are in solidarity with Palestinians during the Israel-Hamas war in the Gaza Strip.

title: Arizona wildfire: Firefighters battle to control blaze; tankers, helicopters come to aid
'Not stranded': Nasa insists Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams 'enjoying their time' at space station
content: Nasa astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams, aboard Boeing's Starliner, remain at the ISS as engineers address thruster and helium leak issues. Nasa's Steve Stich assures their safety and no rush to return. Ground tests are planned. Despite challenges, the astronauts are assisting ISS operations, and provisions are sufficient for an extended stay.
summary: Nasa astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams, aboard Boeing's Starliner, remain at the ISS as engineers address thruster and helium leak issues. Nasa's Steve Stich assures their safety and no rush to return. Ground tests are planned. Despite challenges, the astronauts are assisting ISS operations, and provisions are sufficient for an extended stay.

title: 'George Floyd 3.0': Missouri prison guards charged with murder in death of Black man
Trump tells Biden to ‘get the hell out of here’ in first post-debate speech
content: Throughout his speech, Trump repeated false statements about various issues, including abortion, immigration, climate change, and the 2020 election. He told Biden that the country “doesn’t want” him and to “get the hell out of here."
summary: Throughout his speech, Trump repeated false statements about various issues, including abortion, immigration, climate change, and the 2020 election. He told Biden that the country “doesn’t want” him and to “get the hell out of here."

title: US supreme court rules in favor of January 6 rioters
Vladimir Putin orders production of banned missiles after scrapping of treaty with US
content: ​​The Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) treaty, signed by Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev and President Ronald Reagan in 1988, prohibited ground-based nuclear and conventional missiles with a range of 500-5,500 kilometers (310-3,410 miles) and was considered a significant arms control achievement.
summary: ​​The Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) treaty, signed by Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev and President Ronald Reagan in 1988, prohibited ground-based nuclear and conventional missiles with a range of 500-5,500 kilometers (310-3,410 miles) and was considered a significant arms control achievement.

title: Trump's relentless attacks & falsehoods
content: In Thursday night's debate, former President Trump relentlessly attacked President Biden, labeling him as ineffective and corrupt with frequent falsehoods and misleading statements. Trump accused Biden of being "weak," corrupt, and responsible for a wave of immigrant crime, claims lacking evidence. He also falsely claimed Biden encouraged Russia to attack Ukraine. Despite Biden's defensive stance, he managed a few counterattacks, accusing Trump of immoral behavior. The debate saw Trump capitalizing on Biden's halting speech and criticizing his immigration policies and international leadership, including baseless allegations of corruption involving China.
summary: In Thursday night's debate, former President Trump relentlessly attacked President Biden, labeling him as ineffective and corrupt with frequent falsehoods and misleading statements. Trump accused Biden of being "weak," corrupt, and responsible for a wave of immigrant crime, claims lacking evidence. He also falsely claimed Biden encouraged Russia to attack Ukraine. Despite Biden's defensive stance, he managed a few counterattacks, accusing Trump of immoral behavior. The debate saw Trump capitalizing on Biden's halting speech and criticizing his immigration policies and international leadership, including baseless allegations of corruption involving China.

title: Obama to Biden's rescue: 'Bad debate nights happen, Trust me'
content: Biden's support marked a shift in the Democrat narrative which was in favor of an alternative candidate as soon as the debate ended, but hours later it threw its weight behind Biden -- making it clear that Biden will not opt out of the contest. Biden too -- in his rally in North Carolina-- acknowledged his age-related frailties and said he was aware that he was not a young man and could not debate as he used to, but he knew his job, he knew the right and the wrong.
summary: Biden's support marked a shift in the Democrat narrative which was in favor of an alternative candidate as soon as the debate ended, but hours later it threw its weight behind Biden -- making it clear that Biden will not opt out of the contest. Biden too -- in his rally in North Carolina-- acknowledged his age-related frailties and said he was aware that he was not a young man and could not debate as he used to, but he knew his job, he knew the right and the wrong.

title: Sept 10: A date for Biden to redeem self
content: At the US presidential debate, Joe Biden struggled to counter Donald Trump, leading to disappointment among Democrats. Despite calls to quit, Biden plans to prepare for the second debate on September 10. Notable figures like Maria Shriver and Claire McCaskill expressed concerns about Biden’s performance, while Hillary Clinton urged voters to see the bigger picture. Facing criticism about his age, Biden acknowledged his debate shortcomings but affirmed his capability to lead. Both campaigns reported significant fundraising, with Biden raising $14 million and Trump over $8 million.
summary: At the US presidential debate, Joe Biden struggled to counter Donald Trump, leading to disappointment among Democrats. Despite calls to quit, Biden plans to prepare for the second debate on September 10. Notable figures like Maria Shriver and Claire McCaskill expressed concerns about Biden’s performance, while Hillary Clinton urged voters to see the bigger picture. Facing criticism about his age, Biden acknowledged his debate shortcomings but affirmed his capability to lead. Both campaigns reported significant fundraising, with Biden raising $14 million and Trump over $8 million.
